DataElement.preferredName: Person Bilateral Arm Volume And Range of Motion Measurement Point Loading Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response to indicate if arm volume and mobility measurements points are to be loaded.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Bilateral Arm Volume And Range of Motion Measurement Point Loading
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being._Affecting both sides of the body or a matched pair of organs._The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the elbow. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole superior limb._The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._A measure of joint flexibility consisting of flexion, how far it can bend, and extension, how far it can stretch. It is usually measured by the number of degrees from the starting position of a segment to its position at the end of its arc._Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard._A numeric unit used to quantify a score._To fill or to place an object onto or into a structure or conveyence; in computer terms, to copy data into memory.

Property.preferredName: Bilateral Arm Volume And Range of Motion Measurement Point Loading
Property.preferredDefinition: Affecting both sides of the body or a matched pair of organs.:The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the elbow. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole superior limb.:The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:A measure of joint flexibility consisting of flexion, how far it can bend, and extension, how far it can stretch. It is usually measured by the number of degrees from the starting position of a segment to its position at the end of its arc.:Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.:A numeric unit used to quantify a score.:To fill or to place an object onto or into a structure or conveyence; in computer terms, to copy data into memory.

Concepts.definition: Affecting both sides of the body or a matched pair of organs.
The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the elbow. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole superior limb.
The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.

A measure of joint flexibility consisting of flexion, how far it can bend, and extension, how far it can stretch. It is usually measured by the number of degrees from the starting position of a segment to its position at the end of its arc.
Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.
A numeric unit used to quantify a score.
To fill or to place an object onto or into a structure or conveyence; in computer terms, to copy data into memory.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
